summary: The Chief Herbert D. Proffitt Act of 2025 amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to include certain retired law enforcement officers in the public safety officers’ death benefits program. Specifically, it allows retired officers to receive benefits if they die or are permanently disabled due to a targeted attack stemming from their former service. The bill specifies the definition of a "retired law enforcement officer" and includes retroactive applicability with an exception for actions taken before August 28, 2012.
